message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.SI 

The paper deals with the problem of ticket routing in customer service, which involves matching unresolved service incidents to the right group of service experts. This problem is relevant to several subfields of computer science, including artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), information retrieval (cs.IR), computational linguistics (cs.CL), and social and information networks (cs.SI). The paper proposes a unified framework for ticket routing that uses four types of features derived from tickets, groups, and their interactions, and evaluates the framework using two ranking models. The paper's focus on modeling and optimization makes it most likely to belong to the AI and machine learning subcategories, but its use of natural language processing and network analysis techniques also suggests relevance to the other subcategories listed.
